entry.title: SNOW SQUALL WATCH, Tadoussac

entry.title: Wednesday night: Flurries at times heavy. Low minus 11.
entry.summary: Partly cloudy. Becoming cloudy near midnight. Flurries at times heavy beginning overnight. Risk of snow squalls overnight. Amount 2 to 4 cm. Wind east 20 km/h gusting to 40 becoming west 40 gusting to 60 overnight. Low minus 11. Forecast issued 3:45 PM EDT Wednesday 29 March 2023

entry.title: Thursday: Flurries at times heavy. High minus 5.
entry.summary: Flurries at times heavy ending in the afternoon then cloudy. Risk of snow squalls early in the morning. Local blowing snow. Wind west 40 km/h gusting to 60. High minus 5. Wind chill minus 22 in the morning and minus 13 in the afternoon. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 3:45 PM EDT Wednesday 29 March 2023

entry.title: Thursday night: Clearing. Low minus 14.
entry.summary: Clearing in the evening. Wind northwest 20 km/h gusting to 40 becoming light in the evening. Low minus 14. Wind chill minus 13 in the evening and minus 19 overnight. Forecast issued 3:45 PM EDT Wednesday 29 March 2023
